sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &app; is developed in the Python programming language, and its interface is built with the GTK Toolkit. It's also worth to mention that the initial development is sponsored by Google's Summer of Code.

The project goal is to develop a nmap frontend that is really useful for advanced users and easy to be used by newbies. With UMIT, a network admin can create scan profiles for faster and easier network scanning and even compare scan results to easily see any changes. New users can also construct powerful scans with UMIT command creator wizard.

sect1.title: Installation
sect1.para:
UMIT is available for multiple platforms. It has been successfully tested on the following platforms/flavors:
Ubuntu 5.04 Hoary Hedgeog
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4
OpenBSD 3.7
Microsoft Windows 2000
Microsoft Windows XP
Apple MacOS X 10.4 (Panther)
The installation instructions are somewhat different for each platform.

sect2.title: Default (source) Installation
sect2.para: The UMIT's source package are provided in such a way that, if you have all the required software, it will run 'out-of-the-tarball'.

The list of required software follows:
Python 2.3 or higher
GTK+ 2.4 or higher
HIGWidgets revision 49 (a.k.a. 0.0.1) or higher
nmap itself and its requirements

After unpacking the source distribution do one of the following:
Double click the umit.pyw file
Call the Python interpreter on the umit.pyw file

sect2.title: GNU/Linux Installation
sect2.para: Because of the diversity within GNU/Linux distributions, the installatio instructions are also different.

sect3.title: Ubuntu 5.04 Hoary Hedgeog Installation
sect3.para: The UMIT Packaging Team will provide a ready to use APT source for Hoary Hedgeog Users.

sect2.title: Microsoft Windows Installation
sect2.para: For the Microsoft Windows platform, ready to run installers are available. Download them from the SourceForge project page.

sect1.title: Basic Usage
sect1.para: This section presents the most basic usage of UMIT, including a sample tutorial session.

When started for the first time, UMIT presents you with one Scan Tab. You can use as many Scan Tabs as you want, one for each scan. With each Scan Tab, perform these basic steps:
Enter a scan target, this can be a host name or a IP address.
Select an existing scan profile.
Optionally, customize the generated command
Hit Start Scan
Wait for the scan to finish, and see the results
